intro: Senecio illapelinus, commonly known as the Illapel senecio, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It features slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
